greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of solutions to x^7 == 1 (mod n).
comment: All terms are powers of 7. Those n such that a(n) > 1 are in A066502.
link: Jianing Song, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Multiplicative with a(7) = 1, a(7^e) = 7 if e >= 2; for other primes p, a(p^e) = 7 if p == 1 (mod 7), a(p^e) = 1 otherwise.
If the multiplicative group of integers modulo n is isomorphic to C_{k_1} x C_{k_2} x ... x C_{k_m}, where k_i divides k_j for i < j; then a(n) = Product_{i=1..m} gcd(7, k_i).
results.author: _Jianing Song_, Sep 10 2018
